   20: -module(os_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([space_in_cwd/1, quoting/1, cmd_unicode/1, 
   26:          env/1,
   27:          null_in_command/1, space_in_name/1, bad_command/1,
   28: 	 find_executable/1, unix_comment_in_command/1, deep_list_command/1,
   29:          large_output_command/1, background_command/0, background_command/1,
   30:          message_leak/1, close_stdin/0, close_stdin/1, max_size_command/1,
   31:          perf_counter_api/1, error_info/1, os_cmd_shell/1]).
   32: 
   33: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   34: 
   35: suite() ->
   36:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   37:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   38: 
   39: all() ->
   40:     [space_in_cwd, quoting, cmd_unicode, null_in_command,
   41:      space_in_name, bad_command,
   42:      env,
   43:      find_executable, unix_comment_in_command, deep_list_command,
   44:      large_output_command, background_command, message_leak,
   45:      close_stdin, max_size_command, perf_counter_api,
   46:      error_info, os_cmd_shell].
   47: 
   48: groups() ->
   49:     [].
   50: 
   51: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   52:     os:internal_init_cmd_shell(),
   53:     Config.
   54: 
   55: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   56:     ok.
   57: 
   58: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: init_per_testcase(TC, Config)
   65:   when TC =:= background_command; TC =:= close_stdin; TC =:= os_cmd_shell ->
   66:     case os:type() of
   67:         {win32, _} ->
   68:             {skip,"Should not work on windows"};
   69:         _ ->
   70:             Config
   71:     end;
   72: init_per_testcase(_TC,Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: end_per_testcase(_,_Config) ->
   76:     ok.
   77: 
   78: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   79:     Env0 = os:env(),
   80:     GetEnv0 = os:getenv(),
   81:     lists:foldl(fun({K,V}, [KV | T]) ->
   82:                         KV = K ++ "=" ++ V,
   83:                         V = os:getenv(K),
   84:                         V = os:getenv(K, default),
   85:                         T
   86:                 end,
   87:                 GetEnv0,
   88:                 Env0),
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: %% Test that executing a command in a current working directory
   92: %% with space in its name works.
   93: space_in_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   94:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   95:     Dirname = filename:join(PrivDir, "cwd with space"),
   96:     ok = file:make_dir(Dirname),
   97:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dirname),
   98: 
   99:     %% Using `more' gives the almost the same result on both Unix and Windows.
  100: 
  101:     Cmd = case os:type() of
  102: 	      {win32, _} ->
  103: 		  "more";
  104: 	      {unix, _} ->
  105: 		  "more </dev/null"
  106: 	  end,
  107: 
  108:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  109: 	[] -> ok;				% Unix.
  110: 	"\r\n" -> ok;			% Windows.
  111: 	Other ->
  112: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  113:     end,
  114: 
  115:     ct:sleep(5),
  116:     [] = receive_all(),
  117:     ok.
  118: 
  119: %% Test that various ways of quoting arguments work.
  120: quoting(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  121:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  122:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  123: 
  124:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  125:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  126:     comp("one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\"")),
  127:     comp("x::one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\" y")),
  128:     comp("x::one two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"one two\"")),
  129:     comp("one two::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " \"one two\" y")),
  130:     comp("x::::y", os:cmd(Echo ++ " x \"\" y")),
  131:     ct:sleep(5),
  132:     [] = receive_all(),
  133:     ok.
  134: 
  135: 
  136: %% Test that unicode arguments work.
  137: cmd_unicode(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  139:     Echo = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo"),
  140: 
  141:     comp("one", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one")),
  142:     comp("one::two", os:cmd(Echo ++ " one two")),
  143:     comp("åäö::ϼΩ", os:cmd(Echo ++ " åäö " ++ [1020, 937])),
  144:     ct:sleep(5),
  145:     [] = receive_all(),
  146:     ok.
  147: 
  148: null_in_command(_Config) ->
  149:     {Ok, Error} = case os:type() of
  150:                       {win32,_} -> {"dir", "di\0r"};
  151:                       _ -> {"ls", "l\0s"}
  152:                   end,
  153:     true = is_list(try os:cmd(Ok) catch Class0:_ -> Class0 end),
  154:     error = try os:cmd(Error) catch Class1:_ -> Class1 end,
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: %% Test that program with a space in its name can be executed.
  158: space_in_name(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  159:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  160:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  161:     Spacedir = filename:join(PrivDir, "program files"),
  162:     Ext = case os:type() of
  163: 	      {win32,_} -> ".exe";
  164: 	      _ -> ""
  165: 	  end,
  166:     OrigEcho = filename:join(DataDir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  167:     Echo0 = filename:join(Spacedir, "my_echo" ++ Ext),
  168: 
  169:     %% Copy the `my_echo' program to a directory whose name contains a space.
  170: 
  171:     ok = file:make_dir(Spacedir),
  172:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(OrigEcho),
  173:     ok = file:write_file(Echo0, Bin),
  174:     Echo = filename:nativename(Echo0),
  175:     ok = file:change_mode(Echo, 8#777),	% Make it executable on Unix.
  176: 
  177:     %% Run the echo program.
  178:     %% Quoting on windows depends on if the full path of the executable
  179:     %% contains special characters. Paths when running common_tests always
  180:     %% include @, why Windows would always fail if we do not double the
  181:     %% quotes (this is the behaviour of cmd.exe, not Erlang's idea).
  182:     Quote = case os:type() of
  183:                 {win32,_} ->
  184: 		    case (Echo -- "&<>()@^|") =:= Echo of
  185: 		        true -> "\"";
  186: 			false -> "\"\""
  187: 	 	    end;
  188: 		_ ->
  189: 		    "\""
  190: 	    end,
  191:     comp("", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote)),
  192:     comp("a::b::c", os:cmd(Quote ++ Echo ++ Quote ++ " a b c")),
  193:     ct:sleep(5),
  194:     [] = receive_all(),
  195:     ok.
  196: 
  197: %% Check that a bad command doesn't crasch the server or the emulator (it used to).
  198: bad_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  199:     catch os:cmd([a|b]),
  200:     catch os:cmd({bad, thing}),
  201: 
  202:     %% This should at least not crash (on Unix it typically returns
  203:     %% a message from the shell).
  204:     os:cmd("xxxxx"),
  205: 
  206:     ok.
  207: 
  208: find_executable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  209:     case os:type() of
  210: 	{win32, _} ->
  211: 	    DataDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "win32"),
  212: 	    ok = file:set_cwd(filename:join([DataDir, "current"])),
  213: 	    Bin = filename:join(DataDir, "bin"),
  214: 	    Abin = filename:join(DataDir, "abin"),
  215: 	    UsrBin = filename:join([DataDir, "usr", "bin"]),
  216: 	    {ok, Current} = file:get_cwd(),
  217: 
  218: 	    Path = lists:concat([Bin, ";", Abin, ";", UsrBin]),
  219: 	    io:format("Path = ~s", [Path]),
  220: 
  221: 	    %% Search for programs in Bin (second element in PATH).
  222: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  223: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  224: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  225: 	    %% OTP-3626 find names of executables given with extension
  226: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.exe", "", Path),
  227: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.com", "", Path),
  228: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb.bat", "", Path),
  229: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar.EXE", "", Path),
  230: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii.COM", "", Path),
  231: 	    find_exe(Abin, "MY_ADB.BAT", "", Path),
  232: 
  233: 	    %% Search for programs in Abin (second element in PATH).
  234: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ar", ".exe", Path),
  235: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_ascii", ".com", Path),
  236: 	    find_exe(Abin, "my_adb", ".bat", Path),
  237: 
  238: 	    %% Search for programs in the current working directory.
  239: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_program", ".exe", Path),
  240: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_command", ".com", Path),
  241: 	    find_exe(Current, "my_batch", ".bat", Path),
  242: 	    ok;
  243: 	{unix, _}  ->
  244: 	    DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  245: 
  246: 	    %% Smoke test.
  247: 	    case ct:get_progname() of
  248: 		"erl" ->
  249: 		    ErlPath = os:find_executable("erl"),
  250: 		    true = is_list(ErlPath),
  251: 		    true = filelib:is_regular(ErlPath);
  252: 		_ ->
  253: 		    %% Don't bother -- the progname could include options.
  254: 		    ok
  255: 	    end,
  256: 
  257: 	    %% Never return a directory name.
  258: 	    false = os:find_executable("unix", [DataDir]),
  259: 	    ok
  260:     end.
  261: 
  262: find_exe(Where, Name, Ext, Path) ->
  263:     Expected = filename:join(Where, Name++Ext),
  264:     case os:find_executable(Name, Path) of
  265: 	Expected ->
  266: 	    ok;
  267: 	Name when is_list(Name) ->
  268: 	    case filename:absname(Name) of
  269: 		Expected ->
  270: 		    ok;
  271: 		Other ->
  272: 		    io:format("Expected ~p; got (converted to absolute) ~p",
  273: 			      [Expected, Other]),
  274: 		    ct:fail(failed)
  275: 	    end;
  276: 	Other ->
  277: 	    io:format("Expected ~p; got ~p", [Expected, Other]),
  278: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  279:     end.
  280: 
  281: %% OTP-1805: Test that os:cmd(\ls #\) works correctly (used to hang).
  282: unix_comment_in_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  283:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  284:     ok = file:set_cwd(Priv),
  285:     _ = os:cmd("ls #"),			% Any result is ok.
  286:     ct:sleep(5),
  287:     [] = receive_all(),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: %% Check that a deep list in command works equally on unix and on windows.
  291: deep_list_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  292:     %% As a 'io_lib' module description says: "There is no guarantee that the
  293:     %% character lists returned from some of the functions are flat, they can
  294:     %% be deep lists."
  295:     %% That's why os:cmd/1 can have arguments that are deep lists.
  296:     %% It is not a problem for unix, but for windows it is (in R15B02 for ex.).
  297:     Echo = os:cmd([$e, $c, "ho"]),
  298:     true = erlang:is_list(Echo),
  299:     %% FYI: [$e, $c, "ho"] =:= io_lib:format("ec~s", ["ho"])
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: %% Test to make sure that the correct data is
  303: %% received when doing large commands.
  304: large_output_command(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  305:     %% Maximum allowed on windows is 8192, so we test well below that
  306:     AAA = lists:duplicate(7000, $a),
  307:     comp(AAA,os:cmd("echo " ++ AAA)).
  308: 
  309: %% Test that it is possible on unix to start a background task using os:cmd.
  310: background_command() ->
  311:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  312: background_command(_Config) ->
  313:     %% This testcase fails when the os:cmd takes
  314:     %% longer then the 5 second timeout
  315:     os:cmd("sleep 10&").
  316: 
  317: %% Test that message does not leak to the calling process
  318: message_leak(_Config) ->
  319:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  320: 
  321:     os:cmd("echo hello"),
  322:     [] = receive_all(),
  323: 
  324:     case os:type() of
  325:         {unix, _} ->
  326:             os:cmd("for i in $(seq 1 100); do echo hello; done&"),
  327:             [] = receive_all();
  328:         _ ->
  329:             ok % Cannot background on non-unix
  330:     end,
  331: 
  332:     process_flag(trap_exit, false).
  333: 
  334: %% Test that os:cmd closes stdin of the program that is executed
  335: close_stdin() ->
  336:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 5}}].
  337: close_stdin(Config) ->
  338:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  339:     Fds = filename:join(DataDir, "my_fds"),
  340: 
  341:     "0" = os:cmd(Fds).
  342: 
  343: max_size_command(_Config) ->
  344:     WSL = case os:getenv("WSLENV") of
  345:               false -> "";
  346:               _ -> "wsl "
  347:           end,
  348: 
  349:     Res20 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 20 }),
  350:     20 = length(Res20),
  351: 
  352:     Res0 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 0 }),
  353:     0 = length(Res0),
  354: 
  355:     Res32768 = os:cmd(WSL ++ "cat /dev/zero", #{ max_size => 32768 }),
  356:     32768 = length(Res32768),
  357: 
  358:     ResHello = string:trim(os:cmd("echo hello", #{ max_size => 20 })),
  359:     5 = length(ResHello).
  360: 
  361: %% Test that the os:perf_counter api works as expected
  362: perf_counter_api(_Config) ->
  363: 
  364:     true = is_integer(os:perf_counter()),
  365:     true = os:perf_counter() > 0,
  366: 
  367:     Conv = fun(T1, T2) ->
  368:                    erlang:convert_time_unit(T2 - T1, perf_counter, nanosecond)
  369:            end,
  370: 
  371:     do_perf_counter_test([], Conv, 120000000, 80000000),
  372:     do_perf_counter_test([1000], fun(T1, T2) -> T2 - T1 end, 120, 80).
  373: 
  374: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower) ->
  375:     %% We run the test multiple times to try to get a somewhat
  376:     %% stable value... what does this test? That the
  377:     %% calculate_perf_counter_unit in sys_time.c works somewhat ok.
  378:     do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, 10).
  379: 
  380: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, _Conv, Upper, Lower, 0) ->
  381:     ct:fail("perf_counter_test ~p ~p ~p",[CntArgs, Upper, Lower]);
  382: do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters) ->
  383: 
  384:     T1 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  385:     timer:sleep(100),
  386:     T2 = apply(os, perf_counter, CntArgs),
  387:     TsDiff = Conv(T1, T2),
  388:     ct:log("T1: ~p~n"
  389:            "T2: ~p~n"
  390:            "TsDiff: ~p~n",
  391:            [T1,T2,TsDiff]),
  392: 
  393:     if
  394:         TsDiff < Upper, TsDiff > Lower ->
  395:             ok;
  396:         true ->
  397:             do_perf_counter_test(CntArgs, Conv, Upper, Lower, Iters-1)
  398:     end.
  399: 
  400: error_info(Config) ->
  401: 
  402: 
  403:     ExhaustFDs =
  404:         fun(M,F,A) ->
  405:                 case no_limit_for_opened_files() of
  406:                     false ->
  407:                         {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  408:                         FN = filename:join(
  409:                                proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  410:                                "error_info"),
  411:                         try
  412:                             erpc:call(
  413:                               Node,
  414:                               fun() ->
  415:                                       io:format("Starting to open files..."),
  416:                                       (fun FDs(N) ->
  417:                                                case file:open(FN, [write]) of
  418:                                                    {ok, _ } -> FDs(N+1);
  419:                                                    {error, _} ->
  420:                                                        io:format("Opened ~p files",[N])
  421:                                                end
  422:                                        end)(0),
  423:                                       apply(M,F,A)
  424:                               end)
  425:                         catch error:{exception, ErrorReason, StackTrace} ->
  426:                                 erlang:raise(error, ErrorReason, StackTrace)
  427:                         after
  428:                             peer:stop(Peer)
  429:                         end;
  430:                     true ->
  431:                         apply(M,F,A)
  432:                 end
  433:         end,
  434: 
  435:     L = [{cmd, [{no, string}]},
  436:          {cmd, [["echo 1",0,0,0,1]]},
  437:          {cmd, [{no, string}, #{}]},
  438:          {cmd, [{no, string}, no_map]},
  439:          {cmd, ["echo 1"], [{general, "too many open files \\(emfile\\)"},
  440:                             {wrapper, ExhaustFDs}] ++
  441:               [no_fail || no_limit_for_opened_files()]},
  442: 
  443:          {find_executable, 1},                  %Not a BIF.
  444:          {find_executable, 2},                  %Not a BIF.
  445: 
  446:          {getenv, [a]},
  447:          {getenv, [[<<"bin">>]]},
  448:          {getenv, [[-1]]},
  449:          {getenv, [[999999999999999]]},
  450:          {getenv, [["abc"|improper_tail]]},
  451:          {getenv, ["abc="]},
  452:          {getenv, ["abc\0xyz"]},
  453: 
  454:          {getenv,[a, default]},
  455: 
  456:          {perf_counter,[bad_time_unit]},
  457: 
  458:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, <<"bad_value">>],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  459:          {putenv, ["key", <<"bad_value">>]},
  460:          {putenv, [<<"bad_key">>, "value"]},
  461:          {putenv, ["abc=", "xyz"]},
  462: 
  463:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  464:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, ignore]},
  465:          {set_signal, [bad_signal, bad_handling]},
  466:          {set_signal, [{bad,signal}, bad_handling],[{1,".*"},{2,".*"}]},
  467: 
  468:          {system_time, [bad_time_unit]},
  469:          {unsetenv, [{bad,key}]}
  470:         ],
  471:     error_info_lib:test_error_info(os, L).
  472: 
  473: os_cmd_shell(Config) ->
  474:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  475:     SysShell = filename:join(DataDir, "sys_shell"),
  476: 
  477:     {ok, OldShell} = application:get_env(kernel, os_cmd_shell),
  478:     application:set_env(kernel, os_cmd_shell, SysShell),
  479: 
  480:     %% os:cmd should not try to detect the shell location rather than use
  481:     %% the value from kernel:os_cmd_shell parameter
  482:     Ls = os:cmd("ls"),
  483:     application:set_env(kernel, os_cmd_shell, OldShell),
  484:     comp("sys_shell", Ls).
  485: 
  486: no_limit_for_opened_files() ->
  487:     case os:type() of
  488:         {unix, freebsd} ->
  489:             %% At least some FreeBSD systems support about one million open
  490:             %% files, which means that we run out of Erlang processes before we
  491:             %% reach the open file limit.
  492:             true;
  493:         {unix, _} ->
  494:             false;
  495:         _ ->
  496:             true
  497:     end.
  498: 
  499: %% Util functions
  500: 
  501: comp(Expected, Got) ->
  502:     case strip_nl(Got) of
  503: 	Expected ->
  504: 	    ok;
  505: 	Other ->
  506: 	    ok = io:format("Expected: ~ts\n", [Expected]),
  507: 	    ok = io:format("Got:      ~ts\n", [Other]),
  508: 	    ct:fail(failed)
  509:     end.
  510: 
  511: %% strips \n and \r\n from end of string
  512: 
  513: strip_nl([$\r, $\n]) -> [];
  514: strip_nl([$\n])      -> [];
  515: strip_nl([H|T])      -> [H|strip_nl(T)];
  516: strip_nl([])         -> [].
  517: 
  518: receive_all() ->
  519:     receive
  520: 	X -> [X|receive_all()]
  521:     after 0 -> []
  522:     end.
